intro: Eriosema rugosum, commonly known as the rough eriosema, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often with a distinctive, spurred shape. Eriosema rugosum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
